page.title: 04Houses in Warcop & Bleatarn
page.content: Most houses in Warcop and Bleatarn are made of stone.Some are plain stone and some are covered with pebble dash. This is when all the stone is covered with cement.When this is dry pebbles are stuck on. A few are modern buildings made of brick and partly pebble dashed. Out of 119 houses, 48 are terraced, 24 are detached, 21 are semi-detached, 8 are council houses, 6 are bungalows and 6 are farm houses; 3 houses are used to give holiday makers a place to stay with a bed to sleep in and breakfast provided; 2 houses are let to holiday makers who look after them selves.There is only 1 public house, "The Chamley Arms". Most people own their own house, though some are tied cottages owned by farmers to let to their workers.
